newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton prices fall ahead of crucial meet.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton prices fall ahead of crucial meet.

text.p: Indian cotton prices fell on low volumes and ahead of a meeting of the official Cotton Advisory Board later on Friday, dealers said.
The board is expected to discuss India's cotton demand and supply situation, they said. Mill demand remained low while higher new crop arrivals triggered fresh offerings they said.

In spot deals Bengal-deshi fell by 15/25 rupees to 805/835 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while Punjab saw-ginned slid by 10/30 rupees to 1,360/1,610. Gujarat Sankar-4 (long-staple) however remained steady at 17,500/18,000 rupees per candy (355.56 kg) on limited activity.
